content: Constituency in Singapore (1955–1988)This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Tiong Bahru Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Tiong Bahru Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore. The constituency was formed in 1955 and was abolished in 1988. ## History In 1955, the **Tiong Bahru Constituency** was formed. In 1988, the constituency was abolished following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and [Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC). ## Members of Parliament YearMember of ParliamentParty**Formation (1955)****[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1955William Tan[DP](/wiki/Democratic_Party_(Singapore))1959Lee Teck Him[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968[Ch'ng Jit Koon](/wiki/Ch%27ng_Jit_Koon)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)1972197619801984**Constituency abolished (1988)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election
